sqlQuery.name: AllOrganisms
sqlQuery.sql:
SELECT DISTINCT ON (term) term, display, parentterm, internal FROM ( WITH RECURSIVE TaxonHierarchy AS ( -- Higher-level clades SELECT orthomcl_clade_id, parent_id, name, three_letter_abbrev, is_species FROM apidb.OrthomclClade WHERE is_species = 0
UNION ALL
-- Push hierarchy downward SELECT child.orthomcl_clade_id, child.parent_id, child.name, child.three_letter_abbrev, child.is_species FROM apidb.OrthomclClade child JOIN TaxonHierarchy parent ON child.parent_id = parent.orthomcl_clade_id ),
-- Clade rows CladeRows AS ( SELECT DISTINCT ON (c.three_letter_abbrev) c.three_letter_abbrev AS term, c.name AS display, CASE WHEN c.three_letter_abbrev = 'ALL' THEN NULL WHEN parent.three_letter_abbrev IS NULL THEN 'ALL' ELSE parent.three_letter_abbrev END AS parentTerm, c.three_letter_abbrev AS internal, 0 AS sort_order FROM apidb.OrthomclClade c LEFT JOIN apidb.OrthomclClade parent ON parent.orthomcl_clade_id = c.parent_id ORDER BY c.three_letter_abbrev ),
-- Organism rows (annotated genomes) OrganismRows AS ( SELECT DISTINCT ON (org.orthomcl_abbrev) org.orthomcl_abbrev AS term, tn.name AS display, CASE WHEN parent.three_letter_abbrev IS NULL THEN 'ALL' ELSE parent.three_letter_abbrev END AS parentTerm, org.orthomcl_abbrev AS internal, 1 AS sort_order FROM apidb.Organism org LEFT JOIN sres.taxonname tn ON org.taxon_id = tn.taxon_id LEFT JOIN apidb.OrthomclClade c ON c.three_letter_abbrev = org.orthomcl_abbrev LEFT JOIN apidb.OrthomclClade parent ON parent.orthomcl_clade_id = c.parent_id WHERE org.is_annotated_genome = 1 ORDER BY org.orthomcl_abbrev )
-- Final vocab output SELECT term, display, parentTerm, internal FROM ( SELECT * FROM CladeRows UNION ALL SELECT * FROM OrganismRows ) t ORDER BY sort_order, parentTerm NULLS FIRST, display )

sqlQuery.name: PfamTypeAhead
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT DISTINCT accession AS internal, accession AS term, accession || ' ' || description AS display, description, lower(description) AS lower_description FROM ApidbTuning.DomainAssignment ORDER BY lower_description

sqlQuery.name: EcNumberTypeAhead
sqlQuery.sql:
WITH RECURSIVE leaves AS ( SELECT DISTINCT ec_number, description FROM apidbtuning.sequenceenzymeclass ), recursive_enzyme_class AS ( -- Anchor member SELECT ec.ec_number, ec.parent_id, ec.enzyme_class_id, ec.description FROM sres.enzymeclass ec WHERE ec.ec_number IN (SELECT ec_number FROM leaves)
UNION ALL
-- Recursive member SELECT ec.ec_number, ec.parent_id, ec.enzyme_class_id, ec.description FROM sres.enzymeclass ec JOIN recursive_enzyme_class rec ON ec.enzyme_class_id = rec.parent_id )
-- Final selection with filtering for non-null display SELECT * FROM ( SELECT rec.ec_number AS term, rec.ec_number AS internal, rec.ec_number || ' (' || CASE WHEN rec.ec_number = '-.-.-.-' THEN 'Any Enzyme' ELSE rec.description END || ')' AS display FROM recursive_enzyme_class rec
UNION
SELECT 'N/A' AS term, 'N/A' AS internal, 'N/A' AS display ) AS all_rows WHERE display IS NOT NULL

group.name: corePeripheralAdvancedParams
group.description: OrthoMCL contains two sets of genomes. A Core set of 150 genomes have been chosen as well annotated reference organisms that broadly represent the major branches of the tree of life. All of the additional non-core VEuPathDB organisms (pathogens, hosts, and vectors) are called Peripheral organisms, in some cases including multiple strains and genome assemblies for the same species. The search ranges below can be used to filter the number of proteins {taxa} in each orthogroup by the number of Core and Peripheral (minimum and maximum) in each group. The number of Core and Peripheral will sum to the number of all proteins {taxa} in the group.
